H0.text: In which famous London shop in Piccadilly is there an animated clock on the front, where the original owners turn on the hour to bow to each other. Liberty London

H1.text: In which famous London shop in Piccadilly is there an animated clock on the front, where the original owners turn on the hour to bow to each other. Hamleys

H2.text: In which famous London shop in Piccadilly is there an animated clock on the front, where the original owners turn on the hour to bow to each other. Selfridges

H3.text: In which famous London shop in Piccadilly is there an animated clock on the front, where the original owners turn on the hour to bow to each other. Fortnums

A4.text: Every hour, 4-foot-high (1.2 m) models of William Fortnum and Hugh Mason emerge and bow to each other, with chimes and 18th-century style music playing in the background.

A5.text: The main store is located at 181 Piccadilly in the St James's area of London, where it was established in 1707 by William Fortnum and Hugh Mason.
